MR No. 640 - Cautions Regarding Restaurant Work

     The opening of hygienic restaurants is a work that God would have done in the cities. If wisely conducted, these restaurants will be missionary centers. Those working in them should have at hand publications on health and temperance topics and on other phases of gospel truth, to give to those coming for meals.--Ms 114, 1902, p. 4. ("Instruction Regarding Sanitarium Work," September 1, 1902.)
